The candidate falsely reports findings not described in the reference (COPD and air trapping), gives imprecise descriptions (bilateral apical pleuroparenchymal changes, which may overlap with reference findings but not clearly specify pleural thickening/nodularity), and omits multiple clinically significant findings from the reference (interval improvement, chronic surgical changes, rib resections, bone demineralization, specific assessment of pleural nodules, etc.).

"Bilateral apical pleuroparenchymal changes" is less specific and may confuse location compared to "spiculated common nodular pleural thickening at the right lung apex" and interval changes in bilateral airspace (not specifically apical in the reference).
